{"step_by_step_thinking": "The Bennett angle, named after the British dentist Sir Norman Bennett, is a term used in prosthodontics. It refers to the angle formed by the path that the non-working or balancing side condyle takes as it moves medially and downwards from the horizontal, during lateral mandibular movements. Therefore, it is the angle which the path of balancing side condyle makes with the sagittal plane during Lateral excursion.", "answer_choice": "B"}
